title: PSA: Xin Zhao is an old-ass man
body:
Imperial Xin Zhao is more representative of his age. 
He worked under Jarvan II, our Jarvan's grandfather. 

He is the coolest person in League, hands down.

Jarvan III is still the king, isn't he?
This is why Jarvan IV frequently says, "For my father, the king."

So Xin Zhao was fighting in the Fleshing before the current king of Demacia was king of Demacia, but I don't see why that has to have been a long time ago.

Jarvan's in his 20's, at the youngest. Even assuming J3 and J2 had their sons at 16, that puts J2 at around 52 years old if he were still alive. Though it's probably closer to 20 or above, since LoL doesn't really have the kind of lore where people have children as teenagers. That'd put him at 60 years old. 
Then since the Fleshing wasn't for children, and JII went there himself to liberate the prisoners we can assume he wasn't drastically older than Xin at the time. It stands to reason he's younger, but a decent amount older than J3. That puts him somewhere around 50. 
Definitely the oldest non-magical human in the game. And unlike Jax, with his fake "grandmaster at arms" title (when all he really does is imbue whatever he's holding with magic), Xin is a bona-fide badass.

Xin is probably at his 60's, realistically speaking.

But you know, you can't pass up the old man with the giant spear. He's probably still enjoying his time in the Institute of War being a war grandpa.

Considering the real life general that Riot based Xin Zhao off of, that makes perfect sense.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhao_Yun

He was fighting battles into his 60s, and was known to use a spear. Also, the Warring Kingdoms skin for him is a dead ringer for his appearance in the Dynasty Warriors game series.
